post.body: just did a quick post ref ur slidedeck, just wished you had one more slide - "What we would do different next time around"
that Patton quote is definitely a keeper
Love that post on THCB by Rick Peters, actually ref it in recent post were I trashed the HIMSS blueprint
appears craig is speaking from consumer perspective, I'm looking at it from SW dev. perspective, & thus biz perspective
not so much health2.0, but believe the iPhone and multi-health apps available (over 400) is astounding
good pt, most have not borne fruit, blossoms never bloomed, mostly internal issues, some external, e.g. timing/market readiness
Time Capsule now working, wow, pretty slick, especially when you click "enter time machine" like a Jules Verne novel
2008 was surprisingly good for Chilmark Research, keeping fingers crossed for '09. Plenty of research topics, but are there ready buyers?
HealthVault Adds Another Arrow to its Quiver: Seemingly on a roll, OptumHealth, the consumer facing health and w.. http://tinyurl.com/9lv3xw
finally set-up Apple's Time Capsule which is now, ever so slowly backing up everything on my MPB. Nice system - painless backup
Optum/UHG is the latest payer to sign-on to HealthVault for portability of records (claims data, maybe PBM) http://tinyurl.com/8lbj23
Opps, here's the link: http://tinyurl.com/87a9l9
decent post on APIs, GUIs and platform development, directly applicable to GHealth, HealthVault & Dossia
What’s In Store for 2009: Top Ten Trends & Forecast: Maintaining a tradition among IT analyst firms, follo.. http://tinyurl.com/92bsqk
10. mHealth Apps Continue to Proliferate, Most are Lame
9. Dreams of Big Fed Spending on HIT Do Not Materialize.
8. Continua Compliant Devices Hit Market, Little Impact to Anemic Telehealth Growth
7. New HIE Models Leveraging Cloud Computing and SaaS Gain Traction
6. Chicken and Egg Scenario Plays-out for GHealth & HealthVault
5. Dossia Ramps-up
